thread.title: Hugh Jackman's skin cancer returns for fifth time
thread.title_full: Hugh Jackman's skin cancer returns for fifth time

title: Hugh Jackman's skin cancer returns for fifth time
text:
INSTAGRAM ALL SMILES: Hugh updated his followers after having skin cancer for the fifth time 
The basal cell carcinoma – which according to the British Skin Foundation is the most common form of skin cancer in the UK – returned to his nose and has since been cut out. 
The X-Men actor announced the sad news to his fans on Instagram along with a snap of him wearing a bandage on his nose. 
He said: "Another basal cell carcinoma. 
GETTY AUSSIE HUNK: A make up artist noticed a spot of blood while filming X Men 
"Thanks to frequent body checks and amazing doctors, all is well. 
"Looks worse with the dressing on than off. I swear! #WearSunscreen." 
This is the fifth time the 48-year-old has had the procedure, with him being treated just one year ago with the same issue. Celebrity cancer survivors Monday, 24th October 2016 Here are the celebrities who put up a strong fight against cancer and came out victorious. 1 / 11 SUPPORT: Hugh's wife Deborra-Lee Furness urged him to get a check-up “Looks worse with the dressing on than off. I swear!” Hugh Jackman 
A makeup artist noticed the first time round in 2013, when they saw a spot of blood on his nose while he was filming X Men: Days of Future Past. 
The most common cause is too much exposure to ultraviolet light from the sun or sunbeds. 
The Aussie hunk blamed his Brit roots for being blasé about sun protection, and since his diagnosis he's been championing the importance of taking care of your skin. The warning signs of skin cancer Friday, 4th November 2016 The warning signs and symptoms of skin cancer 1 / 10 Redness or a new swelling beyond the border of the mole 
GETTY CHANGE: Hugh now tells everyone they ned to protect their skin 
"An example of what happens when you don't wear sunscreen," Hugh wrote after the growth had returned for the fourth time. 
"The mildest form of cancer but serious, nonetheless. 
"Please use sunscreen and get regular check-ups." Related articles
